00001 #----------------------------------------------------------------------
00002 #  eliza.py
00003 #
00004 #  a cheezy little Eliza knock-off by Joe Strout <joe@strout.net>
00005 #  with some updates by Jeff Epler <jepler@inetnebr.com>
00006 #  hacked into a module and updated by Jez Higgins <jez@jezuk.co.uk>
00007 #  last revised: 28 February 2005
00008 #----------------------------------------------------------------------
00009 
00010 import string
00011 import re
00012 import random
00013 
00014 class eliza:
00015   def __init__(self):
00016     self.keys = map(lambda x:re.compile(x[0], re.IGNORECASE),gPats)
00017     self.values = map(lambda x:x[1],gPats)
00018 
00019   #----------------------------------------------------------------------
00020   # translate: take a string, replace any words found in dict.keys()
00021   #  with the corresponding dict.values()
00022   #----------------------------------------------------------------------
00023   def translate(self,str,dict):
00024     words = string.split(string.lower(str))
00025     keys = dict.keys();
00026     for i in range(0,len(words)):
00027       if words[i] in keys:
00028         words[i] = dict[words[i]]
00029     return string.join(words)
00030 
00031   #----------------------------------------------------------------------
00032   #  respond: take a string, a set of regexps, and a corresponding
00033   #    set of response lists; find a match, and return a randomly
00034   #    chosen response from the corresponding list.
00035   #----------------------------------------------------------------------
00036   def respond(self,str):
00037     # find a match among keys
00038     for i in range(0,len(self.keys)):
00039       match = self.keys[i].match(str)
00040       if match:
00041         # found a match ... stuff with corresponding value
00042         # chosen randomly from among the available options
00043         resp = random.choice(self.values[i])
00044         # we've got a response... stuff in reflected text where indicated
00045         pos = string.find(resp,'%')
00046         while pos > -1:
00047           num = string.atoi(resp[pos+1:pos+2])
00048           resp = resp[:pos] + \
00049             self.translate(match.group(num),gReflections) + \
00050             resp[pos+2:]
00051           pos = string.find(resp,'%')
00052         # fix munged punctuation at the end
00053         if resp[-2:] == '?.': resp = resp[:-2] + '.'
00054         if resp[-2:] == '??': resp = resp[:-2] + '?'
00055         return resp
00056 
00057 #----------------------------------------------------------------------
00058 # gReflections, a translation table used to convert things you say
00059 #    into things the computer says back, e.g. "I am" --> "you are"
00060 #----------------------------------------------------------------------
00061 gReflections = {
00062   "am"   : "are",
00063   "was"  : "were",
00064   "i"    : "you",
00065   "i'd"  : "you would",
00066   "i've"  : "you have",
00067   "i'll"  : "you will",
00068   "my"  : "your",
00069   "are"  : "am",
00070   "you've": "I have",
00071   "you'll": "I will",
00072   "your"  : "my",
00073   "yours"  : "mine",
00074   "you"  : "me",
00075   "me"  : "you"
00076 }
00077 
00078 #----------------------------------------------------------------------
00079 # gPats, the main response table.  Each element of the list is a
00080 #  two-element list; the first is a regexp, and the second is a
00081 #  list of possible responses, with group-macros labelled as
00082 #  %1, %2, etc.  
00083 #----------------------------------------------------------------------
00084 gPats = [
00085   [r'I need (.*)',
00086   [  "Why do you need %1?",
00087     "Would it really help you to get %1?",
00088     "Do you want %l for your city?",
00089     "Are you sure you need %1?"]],
00090   
00091   [r'Why don\'?t you ([^\?]*)\??',
00092   [  "Do you really think I don't %1?",
00093     "Perhaps eventually I will %1.",

00299 #----------------------------------------------------------------------
00300 #  command_interface
00301 #----------------------------------------------------------------------
00302 def command_interface():
00303   print "Therapist\n---------"
00304   print "Talk to the program by typing in plain English, using normal upper-"
00305   print 'and lower-case letters and punctuation.  Enter "quit" when done.'
00306   print '='*72
00307   print "Hello.  How are you feeling today?"
00308   s = ""
00309   therapist = eliza();
00310   while s != "quit":
00311     try: s = raw_input(">")
00312     except EOFError:
00313       s = "quit"
00314       print s
00315     while s[-1] in "!.": s = s[:-1]
00316     print therapist.respond(s)
00317 
00318 
00319 if __name__ == "__main__":
00320   command_interface()
